snippet: That people in one of the rainiest places on the planet struggle to get potable water is emblematic of the profound water challenges that India faces.
abstract: Water shortages in Meghalaya State, India, one of rainiest areas of country, stem from poor hygiene and lack of system maintenance and are emblematic of profound water challenges that India faces; experts anticipate that shortages will worsen as India's population surges.

byline.contributor: Sruthi Gottipati contributed reporting from Meghalaya State, India.

lead_paragraph: That people in one of the rainiest places on the planet struggle to get potable water is emblematic of the profound water challenges that India faces.
